availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses Nelson (Preble County, Ohio, carpenter and agent of the State of Ohio.)

body.p: Preble County, Ohio, carpenter and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Creason Nelson in Preble County, Ohio, on April 10, 1832. Father of James Nelson, Jane Nelson, Wilbur Nelson, Clinton C. Nelson, George W. Nelson, and Olivia Nelson. Carpenter in Preble County in 1850. Carpenter in Preble County in 1860. Sheriff of Preble County from 1864 to 1868.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Preble County, Eaton, p. 237B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Preble County, Gasper Township, p. 159.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Preble County, Washington Township, p. 278B.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Preble County Marriages, Film 000564963.
"Local Department," The Eaton Democrat (Eaton, OH), November 11, 1886, p. 3.
R. E. Lowry, History of Preble County Ohio: Her People, Industries and Institutions (Indianapolis, IN: B. F. Bowen & Company, 1915), 190.
"Moses Nelson (1809-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial 52673923, accessed November 15, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52673923.
